-   Create & organise an RStudio **Project** and plain **R scripts**

## Part A - R Basics

### Create an R script

1.  Launch **RStudio** ‚Üí *File ‚ñ∏ New Project ‚ñ∏ Existing Directory* ‚Üí point to `geo-course/`.
2.  *File ‚ñ∏ New File ‚ñ∏ R Script* ‚Üí save as `week01_intro.R`.
3.  At the very top add:

```{r}
# week01_intro.R  -- your first R commands
print("Hello, GIS world!")
```

Tip: The Files pane mirrors your disk. Use New Folder to keep /data, /scripts, /outputs tidy.

### Install & load libraries

```{r}
# Run **once** per machine
#install.packages(c("tidyverse", "ggplot2", "dplyr", "sf"))
```

```{r}
# Run in every new R session
library(tidyverse)   # loads ggplot2, dplyr, readr, etc.
library(sf)          # spatial data
```

### Core syntax refresher

```{r}

```

```{r}

```

```{r}
# vectors ‚ü∂ simple arithmetic

```

### Import a built-in data set

```{r}
data("mtcars")   # 32 cars √ó 11 variables
head(mtcars)
```

(Later we‚Äôll replace this with real spatial data.)

### Basic data manipulation

```{r}
mtcars |>
  summarise(
    cars        = n(),
    mean_mpg    = mean(mpg),
    best_eff    = max(mpg)
  )
```

Group by cylinders:

```{r}
mtcars |>
  group_by(cyl) |>
  summarise(across(mpg, list(min = min,
                             mean = mean,
                             max = max)))
```

### First ggplot

```{r}
ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = wt, y = mpg)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "Weight (1000 lbs)", y = "Miles / gallon") +
  theme_minimal()
```

Export the plot:

```{r}
ggsave("outputs/mtcars_wt_mpg.png", width = 6, height = 4, dpi = 300)
```

## Part B - QGIS Basics

### Create & save a QGIS project

1.  Open QGIS 3.34 ‚Üí Project ‚ñ∏ New
2.  Project ‚ñ∏ Properties ‚ñ∏ General ‚Üí set Project home to your geo-course/ folder.
3.  Project ‚ñ∏ Save ‚Üí week01_intro.qgz.

This keeps relative paths identical on any PC.

### Tour of the interface

-   Browser Panel ‚Äì navigate to / drag files
-   Layers Panel ‚Äì toggle visibility, styling, grouping
-   Map Canvas ‚Äì the main view
-   Processing Toolbox ‚Äì scripts & analysis tools
-   Top menus: Vector, Raster, Plugins ‚Ä¶

### Add basemaps (XYZ Tiles)

Follow the second method in the blog post https://opengislab.com/‚Ä¶/add-basemaps-in-qgis-30 ‚Äî add QuickMapServices:

1.  Plugins ‚ñ∏ Manage and Install Plugins ‚Üí search QuickMapServices ‚Üí Install.
2.  Web ‚ñ∏ QuickMapServices ‚ñ∏ Settings ‚ñ∏ More services ‚Üí Get contributed pack.
3.  Web ‚ñ∏ QuickMapServices ‚ñ∏ OSM ‚ñ∏ OSM Standard (or any favourite basemap).

### Load sample vector data

Grab the Natural Earth admin-0 countries shapefile (‚âà 10 MB): \* Layer ‚ñ∏ Add Layer ‚ñ∏ Add Vector Layer ‚Üí Protocol ‚Üí URL: https://www.naturalearthdata.com/http//www.naturalearthdata.com/download/50m/cultural/ne_50m_admin_0_countries.zip Geometry column = the_geom ‚Üí Add

Style polygons quickly via Layer Styling ‚ñ∏ single symbol.

### Key plugins to know

Plugin \| Why it matters QuickMapServices \| instant basemaps QuickOSM \| download OSM features by query Processing R Provider \| run R scripts from within QGIS OpenLayers Plugin (legacy) \| alternative basemaps Geometry by Expression \| attribute-driven geometry edits

Install via Plugins dialog as needed.
